data.title: Where is Kabul, Afghanistan on Map Lat Long Coordinates
data.meta_description: Where is Kabul, Afghanistan on map with latitude and longitude gps coordinates are given in both decimal degrees and DMS format, see where Kabul, Afghanistan is located on the map.
data.text:
Kabul, Afghanistan

Latitude and longitude coordinates are: 34.543896, 69.160652.

Kabul (کابل) is the largest city in Afghanistan. It is the capital city of the same name province and the capital city of the country as well. Kabul is located in the east-central part of the country and is a part of the region of the Middle East on the Asian continent. The city can be found about 320 miles south of the border between Afghanistan and Tajikistan. The border between Afghanistan and Pakistan is located almost 170 miles east of the city of Kabul, and the distance between Kabul and Islamabad is about 230 miles. Other large cities of Afghanistan located close to Kabul are Kindiz, Kandahar, Jalalabad, and Peshawar. The neighborhoods of Kabul include the towns of Mosahi, Paghman, Kalakan, Chartot, Surobi, Tagab, etc.

The city of Kabul is situated in a stripe-like area right near the Hindu Kush mountain chain which can be found to the northwest of the city center. The river Darya-e Kabul (the river of Kabul) crosses the city from its western to the eastern side. The city center is located geographically in the southwestern part of the overall city area. Kabul is situated about 5875 feet above sea level and has a total area estimated to be close to four hundred square miles which is quite large for the country's standards. The city is divided into 22 administrative districts, all different in size and location. To the northeast of the city, it is possible to find a large natural park named Nuristan Forest Natural Preserve. Kabul River Dam, located about 22 miles northeast of the city center, is one more notable location near Kabul.
